meanings.definition: A particular form or version of a published text.
meanings.sent1: I bought the latest edition of my favorite book.
meanings.sent2: The library has many editions of classic novels.
meanings.sent3: My friend joked that the new edition of the magazine was so fancy, it looked like a royal decree.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a new edition of happiness, bright and refreshing.
meanings.sent5: The special edition of the comic book had holographic covers that sparkled in the light.

meanings.definition: The total number of copies of a book, newspaper, or other publication printed at one time.
meanings.sent1: The first edition of the newspaper sold out quickly.
meanings.sent2: The bookstore ordered a limited edition of the novel.
meanings.sent3: The huge edition of newspapers stacked in the corner made the room look like a printing factory.
meanings.sent4: The crowd at the concert was like an edition of fans, all cheering in unison.
meanings.sent5: The special edition of the magazine had a golden seal on the cover, marking it as unique.

meanings.definition: The process of preparing a text for publication.
meanings.sent1: The author worked on the final edition of his manuscript.
meanings.sent2: Editing is an important step in the edition of a book.
meanings.sent3: The edition of the report was delayed due to technical issues with the printer.
meanings.sent4: Her revision was like a new edition of the story, with added details and clarity.
meanings.sent5: The edition of the newspaper was filled with breaking news stories that captivated readers.
